data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you face forward, you are facing forward. 9 steps left means to take 9 steps around the circle left. 10 steps right means to take 10 steps across the circle right. It is not possible to return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first part repeats itself in the direction that you were going which is right. The second part repeats its sequence in reverse which is: Take 4 steps, then take four more steps, then turn around, then turn right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you took 6 steps to get back to your starting point, take 6 steps to get to your starting point. If you took 4 steps to turn around you would take 4 steps to turn around and take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

You can' t take 1 step back then. You can' t take 2 steps back then. You can' t take 5 steps back then. The starting point isn't there if you don' t take a 5 step back. So, the answer is No.

The sequence is following the order of steps taken in the given instructions: Take a total of 10 steps. The sequence involves going left and going right to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

The arrow with two long lines pointing towards you is facing forward. When you take 6 steps backward, you change your direction backward. When you take 8 steps left, you change your direction backward. When you take 2 steps left, you change the direction in which you take your first step. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, you can only take one step backward. If you never face forward, you can only take four steps forward. Thus, the answer is No.
